alert.note: Alert for Bryan; Johnston; Marshall (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 13 at 3:11AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Johnston, northwestern Bryan and central Marshall Counties through 345 AM CDT... At 309 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Madill, moving east at 35 mph. This storm will move toward Lake Texoma. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Madill, Kingston, Silo, Mead, Woodville, Little City, Nida, northern Lake Texoma, Oakland, and Mcbride. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Boaters and campers near Lake Texoma should be alert for this approaching thunderstorm. Remember, lightning can strike out to 10 miles from the parent thunderstorm. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Move to safe shelter now! Do not be caught on the water in a thunderstorm.
